segment.source: Use fully qualified doman name with Surface Hub
segment.target: Use fully qualified doman name with Surface Hub

segment.source: Troubleshoot common problems, including setup issues, Exchange ActiveSync errors.
segment.target: Troubleshoot common problems, including setup issues, Exchange ActiveSync errors.

segment.source: When to use a fully qualified domain name with Surface Hub
segment.target: When to use a fully qualified domain name with Surface Hub

segment.source: A fully qualified domain name (FQDN) is a domain name that explicitly states the location in the Domain Name System (DNS) hierarchy.
segment.target: A fully qualified domain name (FQDN) is a domain name that explicitly states the location in the Domain Name System (DNS) hierarchy.

segment.source: All levels of a domain are specified.
segment.target: All levels of a domain are specified.

segment.source: In the case of Skype for Business on the Surface Hub, there are a few scenarios where you need to use a FQDN.
segment.target: In the case of Skype for Business on the Surface Hub, there are a few scenarios where you need to use a FQDN.

segment.source: Multiple DNS suffixes - When your Skype for Business infrastructure has disjointed namespaces such that one or more servers have a DNS suffix that doesn't match the suffix of the sign-in address (SIP) for Skype for Business.
segment.target: Multiple DNS suffixes - When your Skype for Business infrastructure has disjointed namespaces such that one or more servers have a DNS suffix that doesn't match the suffix of the sign-in address (SIP) for Skype for Business.

segment.source: Skype for Business and Exchange suffixes are different - When the suffix of the sign-in address for Skype for Business differs from the suffix of the Exchange address used for the device account.
segment.target: Skype for Business and Exchange suffixes are different - When the suffix of the sign-in address for Skype for Business differs from the suffix of the Exchange address used for the device account.

segment.source: Working with certificates - Large organizations with on-premise Skype for Business servers commonly use certificates with their own root certificate authority (CA).
segment.target: Working with certificates - Large organizations with on-premise Skype for Business servers commonly use certificates with their own root certificate authority (CA).

segment.source: It is common for the CA domain to be different than the domain of the Skype for Business server which causes the certificate to not be trusted, and sign-in fails.
segment.target: It is common for the CA domain to be different than the domain of the Skype for Business server which causes the certificate to not be trusted, and sign-in fails.

segment.source: The Skype app needs to know the FQDN of the certificate in order to set up a trust relationship.
segment.target: The Skype app needs to know the FQDN of the certificate in order to set up a trust relationship.

segment.source: Enterprises typically use Group Policy to push this out to Skype desktop, but Group Policy is not supported on Surface Hub.
segment.target: Enterprises typically use Group Policy to push this out to Skype desktop, but Group Policy is not supported on Surface Hub.

segment.source: Add FQDN to Surface Hub
segment.target: Add FQDN to Surface Hub

segment.source: You use the Settings app on Surface Hub to add FQDN information.
segment.target: You use the Settings app on Surface Hub to add FQDN information.

segment.source: You can add multiple entries, if needed.
segment.target: You can add multiple entries, if needed.

segment.source: To add Skype for Business Server FQDN
segment.target: To add Skype for Business Server FQDN

segment.source: On Surface Hub open the Settings app.
segment.target: On Surface Hub open the Settings app.

segment.source: Navigate to System, Microsoft Surface Hub.
segment.target: Navigate to System, Microsoft Surface Hub.

segment.source: Under Skype for Business, click Add FQDN.
segment.target: Under Skype for Business, click Add FQDN.

segment.source: Type the FQDN for the Skype for Business certificate.
segment.target: Type the FQDN for the Skype for Business certificate.

segment.source: You can type multiple FQDNs separated by a comma.
segment.target: You can type multiple FQDNs separated by a comma.

segment.source: For example: lync.com, outlook.com, lync.glbdns.microsoft.com.
segment.target: For example: lync.com, outlook.com, lync.glbdns.microsoft.com.

segment.source: Add Skype for Business FQDN to Settings
segment.target: Add Skype for Business FQDN to Settings
